title: Taliyah, a ranged mage that does phys damage?
body: What if she was a ranged mage that did physical damage? I mean if shes throwing rocks it wouldnt make sense for her to do magic damage. Rocks are hard. Plus it might make her like a counterpart to yasuo. That would be sick!

replies.body: Rocks deal magic damage, ask Malphite.
{{champion:150}} Says otherwise

> [{quoted}](name=Igotlazy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-04-29T20:09:56.856+0000)
>
> {{champion:150}} Says otherwise

Those are boulders, not rocks.
Boulders are a type of rock

> [{quoted}](name=CarbRundum,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-29T22:07:08.335+0000)
>
> Boulders are a type of rock

Then why don't they deal magical damage?

Because boulders are a magic rock.

Therefore, they deal physical damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Quepha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-29T19:13:26.489+0000)
>
> Rocks deal magic damage, ask Malphite.

Malphite still deals a lot of physical damage due to his W and his high base AD, also possibly Iceborn Gauntlet (if he decides to build it)

he still deals more magic than physical damage, though

Also, AD Malphite used to be a thing before Riot reworked his W

lol yea 

things ive seen malpite's do

have near unlimited movespeed, as in ran around the map in less then 1 second

have 1650+ ad

have 800+ armor

Be an aoe nuclear bomb with 800+ ap

malphite is a strange one at times

Malphite uses his own magic rocks. 
Taliyah uses rocks that can be found everywhere.
Malphite is all magic damage and he's a living boulder, geomagic is still magic dog
because he's alive. maybe inanimate rock does physical.

> [{quoted}](name=LilxPaprika,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-04-29T19:18:01.816+0000)
>
> because he's alive. maybe inanimate rock does physical.

Sounded like the rocks were moving pretty fast to me.
Cars move pretty fast, too. So do asteroids. So do stars, and lots of vehicles. Are they alive too?

> [{quoted}](name=Ackelope,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-30T03:48:08.539+0000)
>
> Cars move pretty fast, too. So do asteroids. So do stars, and lots of vehicles. Are they alive too?

I don't see any reason to discriminate against any of them, they have just as much of a right to be animate as the rest of us.

But if her gimmick were "build AP to increase physical damage spells", why would you ever use her? AD champions are already strong and abundant, and she would have a really hard time buying the stats she needs (AP + armor pen), meaning that basically any other AD caster would do better. Most other stats would be wasted: crit, attack speed, lifesteal.

Azir is probably the closest counterpart, a weird marksman whose attacks scale with AP instead of AD, but that works because AP/AS are still available on items without any wasted stats (he can use CDR, mana, MP5, and health too).
slap a darius passive on a ability and boom
Doesn't that classify her as an AD caster?
yah but not melee
So how would you ensure she just doesn't turn into an ezreal?
or corki? or maybe thats what yo u want just in a different package
yah she could have physical damage spells but  build magic damage.
physical mage, like him ? {{champion:238}}
I was thinking builds ap but all phys spells, and maby some awesome ability/pasive that shreds armor
Maybe it's a support, LOL yeah right.

> [{quoted}](name=MrLlamaWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-04-29T20:07:07.026+0000)
>
> Maybe it's a support, LOL yeah right.

I actually think she will be a support. The last one was Kench, so it's possible. Plus, if you go by what she did in her story, she sounds very support-ish. She popped a soldier off the ground and into the air by making a rock launch him up, she slowed and impeded the movements of soldiers by making rock spikes erupt from the ground to keep them at bay, and then finally she encased the building in a stone prison. That sounds like a support build to me, if we go by these shows of her power as reflective of her kit design.

You're right. I'm just used to supports being super boring conceptually so im not getting my hopes up. I believe Tahm was originally designed to be a top laner, if im not mistaken. Also we just got a taric rework so 2 supports in a row would be highly unlikely, but here's hoping!

> [{quoted}](name=MrLlamaWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2016-04-30T18:43:30.574+0000)
>
> You're right. I'm just used to supports being super boring conceptually so im not getting my hopes up. I believe Tahm was originally designed to be a top laner, if im not mistaken. Also we just got a taric rework so 2 supports in a row would be highly unlikely, but here's hoping!

Taric isn't actually in the lineup for new champ releases though, since he was a relaunch. They're separate pipelines, according to Riot. Which means that the last support was Kench, who was like 5 champions ago. With Taliyah here, they're restarting the chain since there's been one of each other role released since Kench. And fun fact, not only was Kench originally a top laner, he was originally Mega Gnar.

Edit: PLUS we just got a new mid lane mage with Aurelion Sol. Rarely does Riot give us back to back champs in the same role.
dont get my hopes up!!
Heh... have her build AP that does physical damage. ^_^

> [{quoted}](name=Zyra Suit Samus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQOqGR4I,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-04-29T20:10:29.590+0000)
>
> But then she doesn't have access to penetration.... ;-;

A passive that converts magic penetration into armor penetration?

I know literally nothing about this champion, I've seen stuff on the boards but this is the first thread I've actually clicked...

People complaining about not having pen with the AP-Does-Physical issue, either add a pen passive (Kayle?) or just leave it.  AP Fortune doesn't need pen to do shitloads of damage, neither does AD.  Just give her high scalings but basically remove the ability for her to penetrate and she's pretty balanced.  If you don't build against her, you're fucked, but if you do, she's not TOTALLY useless but is manageable.
Due to the story mentioning that she really want's to protect people and not destroy, I am thinking she might be a support.
ad caster it is
I would be down for this. It would add some much needed damage diversity to mages.

Rocks are hard.       XD XD XD this killed me
Also if shes using magic to control the rock then that would intern make it a magic rock. so it makes sense that magic rocks do magic damage
imo
{{champion:81}} {{champion:4}}
I would immediately main an AD Mage. Mainly because mage items are so damn boring in every way.
If Kat's knives can do magic damage, so can Taliyah's rocks.
To be fair kats knives could be specially made, therefore magical. She isnt picking up random knives from the ground.
